result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anita N Coleman

records.addlTxt: Due to court being down, Court rescheduled the final pre-trial with parties via email correspondence. Final pre-trial rescheduled for November 9th, 2022 at 2:00 pm.

Defendant Anita N Coleman in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Fuentes requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anita N Coleman in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Fuentes has not received discovery or an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Festival Foods.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anita N Coleman in court.  Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/09/2022@2p
